meanings.definition: An amino acid that is a constituent of most proteins, especially keratin, the main protein in hair, skin, and nails.
meanings.sent1: Keratin in our hair contains cysteine, helping to keep it strong and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Our bodies need cysteine to build proteins like keratin for our hair, skin, and nails.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that our hair is made up of tiny cysteine building blocks!
meanings.sent4: Just like how bricks are essential for building a house, cysteine is crucial for forming proteins.
meanings.sent5: Imagine cysteine as the magical ingredient that gives our hair its strength and shine.

meanings.definition: A sulfur-containing amino acid that is a component of glutathione, an important antioxidant in the body.
meanings.sent1: Glutathione relies on cysteine to work as a powerful antioxidant in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Cysteine plays a key role in the antioxidant glutathione, protecting our cells from damage.
meanings.sent3: I like to think of cysteine as the superhero sidekick to glutathione, fighting off harmful molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against oxidative stress, cysteine is the shield that protects our cells.
meanings.sent5: Picture cysteine as the guardian angel that keeps our bodies safe from harm.
